content: Satellite Earth station in SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Sentosa Satellite Earth Station" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2020)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* The **Sentosa Satellite Earth Station** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 圣淘沙卫星地面站; [Malay](/wiki/Malay_language): *Stesen Satelit Bumi Sentosa*) is Singapore's first [satellite Earth station](/wiki/Ground_station), located on [Sentosa Island](/wiki/Sentosa_Island). It was opened on 23 October 1971 by then-president [Benjamin Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Sheares). The second antenna was built two years later, in 1972, as the amount of traffic grew. This station is managed and owned by [Singtel](/wiki/Singtel). 1°14′49″N 103°50′10″E﻿ / ﻿1.247°N 103.836°E﻿ / 1.247; 103.836 This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Sentosa Satellite Earth Station
